title: How to Create a Photo Transfer With Packaging Tape

steps.headline: Place a strip of packaging tape across the part of the color copy that you would like to transfer.
Rub the tape down in both directions with the long edge of a ruler, eliminating bumps and bubbles.
Apply more tape where desired and repeat.
Soak the taped image in a bowl of warm water for at least five minutes.
After five minutes, vigorously rub the white side (the back) under running water in a circular motion with your thumbs to remove all the paper.
steps.description: If no running water is available, continue to rub the paper off into the bowl of warm water.

steps.headline: Blot dry to reveal the transferred image.
steps.description: It will closely resemble the image you had originally, but will have a transparent quality.

tyn: Color copies of the photo(s) you want to transfer (must be from a copy that uses toner)
text: Place a strip of packaging tape across the part of the color copy that you would like to transfer.  Rub the tape down in both directions with the long edge of a ruler, eliminating bumps and bubbles.  Apply more tape where desired and repeat.  Soak the taped image in a bowl of warm water for at least five minutes.  After five minutes, vigorously rub the white side (the back) under running water in a circular motion with your thumbs to remove all the paper. If no running water is available, continue to rub the paper off into the bowl of warm water. Blot dry to reveal the transferred image. It will closely resemble the image you had originally, but will have a transparent quality.
sentences: Place a strip of packaging tape across the part of the color copy that you would like to transfer.
Rub the tape down in both directions with the long edge of a ruler, eliminating bumps and bubbles.
Apply more tape where desired and repeat.
Soak the taped image in a bowl of warm water for at least five minutes.
After five minutes, vigorously rub the white side (the back) under running water in a circular motion with your thumbs to remove all the paper.
If no running water is available, continue to rub the paper off into the bowl of warm water.
Blot dry to reveal the transferred image.
It will closely resemble the image you had originally, but will have a transparent quality.
